website_summaries.verdict: Highly versatile, high-power telephoto focal length lens. Quality build for the price, using premium grade parts.
pros: Can double conventional 500 mm lenses into 1000 mm using the powerful 2X Teleconverter
cons: Some users find setup takes too long

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This does take some practice using, but practice pays off. If you're afraid of manual focus, this is not the lens for you. If you want to learn a new skill, buy it. I'm sure the really expensive ones will give you better results, but for my needs, this one is just fine. One thing that has come out of learning manual focus.....I use it more than auto-focus now. Who'd have thunk it?
customer_reviews.author: MLS

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my first attempt shooting the Moon, in the city, with plenty of light around and a very cheap tripod, which shakes at every wind breeze, and I'm pleased about the result and surprised about how easy it was to set up everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replacement works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: The first lens was defective Big Mike's sent me another lens and I'm very happy with it. Also I am hearing impaired and they showed a great deal of patience with me which was greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Harry T Reckner

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend the x500 magnification to capture things like the eclipse ...
customer_reviews.text: I know basically nothing of photography; just borrowed a DSLR from a friend and needed a telephoto lens to capture the eclipse. This worked perfectly for my purposes! I would recommend the x500 magnification to capture things like the eclipse and add the x2 teleconverter for close up shots of the moon (or the sun if you put a solar filter over it). I would also recommend getting a remote to take photos as button pressing is too shaky. Again, my knowledge of photography is extremely low so I don't know what kind of problems this lens would present for a professional. But for laymen like me it was absolutely perfect. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price too high? NO.
customer_reviews.text: Just right and does what the more expensive brands want. For the first time in 38 years my husband got a close up of the Bald Eagle flying around our home. He seems to attract wild life where ever he goes. The humming bird land right on his arms. The deer lay sleeping by the front door. The bob cat just sits there patiently while he focuses in close. Can't wait for him to print them so we can frame them and sell them. These soon will pay for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't receive brand that was pictured - Ultimaxx instead of Vivitar
customer_reviews.text: The pictures in the ad show Vivitar Series 1 lens and 2X tele-converter. Any of the reviews that mention a brand mention Vivitar. What I received was something called Ultimaxx. Now it may be comparable but there are no reviews of Ultimaxx. Anywhere. Now nowhere in the ad is a brand specifically mentioned (which should have been a sign) but the pictures clearly show Vivitar. The first pic is what I received, the second pic is the ad. I returned it and my payment was quickly refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Canonsburgmike

customer_reviews.title: tripod mount broke the first use
customer_reviews.text: I actually like the lens itself, but the first time we mounted it on the tripod, the tripod mount that comes with the lens cracked... It's broken now and I can't even seem to find a replacement one, without having to buy the whole thing again... It's very frustrating...
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good value
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 500mm lens either fixed or zoom but could not afford the cost of Nikkor lenses. You must understand though that this is a totally manual lens. The meter on my entry level DSLR does not work with this lens. I set the shutter speed and ISO on the camera and the f-stop on the lens and use a handheld meter or an educated guess based on experience and understanding of exposure. The focus is also manual (no autofocus) and this lens is not the easiest to focus. All around this is not a bad lens, not the greatest but good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E Reed

customer_reviews.title: not very useful
customer_reviews.text: Don't assume you will easily figure out how to manually set up exposure, ISO and aperture. If you know how it works, it's a pain to use this product, not fun. Also you will absolutely need a very good, heavy, sturdy and expensive tripod (for much higher cost than this lens). Don't bother to buy this lens if you think it will work with a cheap tripod. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got it today and i tried it out, i will take some pictures of the moon once it is out but So far the results are pretty good, the product is good quality for the price, it is simple to use if you know how to use your SLR in a manual mode. The zoom is very powerful, without using the 2x , i was able To zoom into the Sirius star and get this video, looking forwaed to playing more. Adding a picture of the moon i took with this. It did not let in a lot of light so inhad to use a tri-pod and use low shutter speed but picture was clear.
customer_reviews.author: Yogesh Ruwali

customer_reviews.title: Get message “Lens Not Attached” no matter what I do.
customer_reviews.text: According to the description I have a compatible camera. All I can get this lens to do is give me an error message “lens not attached”. Focus is set to manual as instructed. Have tried changing almost all the settings on my camera with no other result. I bought this for a trip to Yellowstone National Park. Was very disappointed to get on my trip only to find out it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Kami Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great manual lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens that takes super sharp moon photos. Using a manual lens is great practice for using your camera in full manual mode. The pictures have turned out infinitely better than using my 300mm lens and cropping the image.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For what it is it's great.
customer_reviews.text: Single purpose. Better know your manual operation of your camera. I still haven't figured it out. Got a few lucky shots. I'm using it with a D7500 Nikon. The lens calls for a few adjustments I can't seem to master on manual mode with my camera. I imagine in time. Those few shots proved what it can do, I just have to figure out what that was. The shots above were taken without the 2x lens. I've nothing to show for that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Practice Practice Practice
customer_reviews.text: This is fully manual focus. There is no shake reduction. A good sturdy tripod is absolute. Practice Practice Practice will result in amazing photos. After taking several shots, this is amazing! I wish I knew about this years ago! Fantastic value!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph in paradice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and connect to my Nikon D5200, only one con there is not a protection bag for the x2 attachment lens, would have been nice to have one included but otherwise love my new lens. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jayde

customer_reviews.title: I'm really pleased. They're not stunningly sharp but they are certainly ...
customer_reviews.text: My lens just arrived. I set my Nikon D5500 to 1000/sec and ISO 1000. I set the lens on f8 and went outside and snapped a few handheld photos. I'm really pleased. They're not stunningly sharp but they are certainly keepers. I'll do some on a tripod later which will help too. For the price, it's hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: all the bad things you hear about NYC based vendors
customer_reviews.text: absolutely outstanding service...all the bad things you hear about NYC based vendors, is not true.....I had a problem that i caused with the lens and Eli from Big Mikes was fantastic in doing whatever it took to solve my problem.....am very pleased with the lens...a"should buy" recommendation from me to all hobby photogs.
customer_reviews.author: JIM Brunet

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are blurred with color shifts
customer_reviews.text: Can't seem to get a good sharp image. Lens is mounted on a tripod, using fast shutter speed, bright sunny day with a timed shutter release. Attached image shows a green belted kingfisher shot from about 300 ft away. It has a definite blue color shift around base of the birds head. Image of water tower was shot from about a mile (est). Both images have been cropped to show detail. Disappointed after paying over $100 for the lens.
customer_reviews.author: PopsFromPA

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase, but difficult to find settings.
customer_reviews.text: This product is okay, but I don't think I would recommend it to other people. It took me a long time to find a setting to go with my Nikon camera with the 500 mm lens and I still have not been successful in finding a setting for the 1000mm using the 2X converter. You definitely have to have a tripod to use this product otherwise your pictures are blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Mealy

customer_reviews.title: This lens is not for casual photography
customer_reviews.text: If you do not plan to practice, then don't buy this lens. I have a D750, which is an amazing camera where low light is concerned, and I am still learning how this works. It is going to take quite a lot of practice. But, the shots I have managed to get right looks quite fine. This is a challenge, but a satisfying one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get up close with is lens.
customer_reviews.text: The moon shot was taken by me with this lens at 1600mm on a tripod with a 2 second timer. This is a totally manual lens. First, you need to have a good understanding of manual photography. So, put your camera in M mode. Take many shots to get the feels of the lens. It does take some fine focus adjustments to get a decent picture. So, yes, this lens does take a half decent picture, especially at night.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Good quality great price
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this lens. It will take some getting used to as it is a manual focus lens. From the few pictures I snapped right after I got it I can tell it has the capability of being a great addition to my setup. The attached photo is one I grabbed right after setting it up on my camera. Make sure you have a tripod or a way to stabilize the camera because it will pick up the slightest movement. I used my my phone app to control my shutter on my Nikon D5500 so I didn’t get the shake. Would recommend it as a good budget friendly addition to anyone’s setup.
customer_reviews.author: BJKey

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Telephoto lens is great!!! I have taken over 1000 pictures of wildlife with it. It is full manual and I recommend a tripod. very good investment for a beginner/hobby. Worked well for dusk/night photos, my pictures would have been better if I had a remote due to camera shake. Only issue I have is that when I mount it to my camera the settings/ focal length are on the bottom of the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: multiple bubbles in lens
customer_reviews.text: There are MULTIPLE bubbles in the lens and it is completely not worth the money to have damaged glass.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: I'm satisfied with the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Since I'm not accustomed to using a manual focus lens, there has been a lot to learn. But I'm happy with the detail of the pictures that I manage to get into sharp focus. It is best used for taking pictures of stationary objects at a fixed distance. If you're accustomed to the point-and-shoot ease of an auto-focus lens, you may struggle with this at first, but the more I use it, the more I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Boring1

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Nice lens, great for taking pictures of the moon. When I first received this, it was missing the converter and mount. I hadn’t opened it right away but when I did, I realized it was missing parts. I called them, they said they would send them to me, and 3 days later, they arrived. They had great customer service and corrected the issue super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amarie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Had no problems whatsoever from the seller. However, the quality of the product is less than ideal. The 2x magnifier isn't very useful, and you encounter a honeycombing effect when focused on objects at a distance. For the cost of this lens you would be far better off purchasing a used Tamron 200mm, which has a better aperture + autofocus, and then have extra money to spare on other gear.
customer_reviews.author: AK47

customer_reviews.title: Low cost but good lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a completely manual telephoto lens, 5which, with a 2X teleconverter (included) will go up to 1000mm. It takes a bit of manual adjustment and experimentation to find the correct aperture, iso rating and shutter speed to give good images, but the effort is well worth it. Images are crisp and clear. For the price, it is excellent value. And, of course, if you have other cameras (sony, samsung, canon etc) the purchase of another Tmount to xxx adapter (usually under $15) will make the lens truly versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Angus Hepburn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lens at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality lens at a heck of a good price. You must be prepared to shoot in manual but other than that it’s a sweet lens. I used it with and without the teleconverter to shoot the moon and got amazing detail. The converter added a bit of distortion, so my pics with just the lens were better. But seriously, crisp image, leightweight for its size. You can’t beat this baby if you want a 500mm lens and you don’t want to sell a kidney to get it.
customer_reviews.author: notb4mybeer

customer_reviews.title: but preliminary tests show this lens has good focal performance
customer_reviews.text: Have not had a chance to put this lens thru its paces, but preliminary tests show this lens has good focal performance, and will do nicely especially at the price i paid for it. If you have in mind one of the many less expensive 500 mm lenses i recommend this one. Comes with teleconverter. Just remember this a MANUAL focus lens. And set your camera at A or M.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: The lens was as described and the magnification was fantastic. It was easy to assemble and use. I did return it with no issues. I have Parkinson's and due to the magnification the slightest movement of the lens, blurs the photo. Even secured to a tripod my tremor affected the outcome of the photos.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens for the Eclipse. I am extremely happy with the results. Completely manual and requires a heavy duty tripod, but for the money it is well worth it. This isn't something you'll typically use often, but it's nice to have for special occasions. Note: I haven't tried the 2x converter, so I have no idea how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: b0hb

customer_reviews.title: Nice Lens
customer_reviews.text: Nice lens, I still have to make time to use it in the right situation to it's full potential and get some good shots. I did use it from a distance at my daughters soccer game and the pics came out clear and sharp but it wasn't the ideal situation for this lens which I knew but still wanted to try it. It came with instructions from 'Big Mike's' which were very helpful and thorough. The lens is manual so you need to work with it but the instructions covered all that.
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 3 girls

customer_reviews.title: Wowzers
customer_reviews.text: Wow amazing! Got my moon shot!!!! Worked with my Nikon D40 and my Nikon D3400
customer_reviews.author: Zombre

customer_reviews.title: Focus On This
customer_reviews.text: While I'm not yet proficient in manual shooting, I like the ease of this lens and the directions that were sent by Big Mike. I'm coming into it pretty fast. It's a great lens for the money. I like the versatility of the 2x adapter option. FAST shipping, also. I didn't think I would get this lens for about a week when I ordered it. It came within a couple days!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nungesser

customer_reviews.title: JUST NOT GREAT
customer_reviews.text: FIND ONE THAT IS MADE BY YOUR CAMARA'S BRAND. QUALITY JUST NOT THERE
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: Missing major part to attach it to my Nikon 3200. Tried to call but no answer. Sad I will not be able to use it this weekend. Really can’t rate it when I can’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Chad cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens on a Budget!
customer_reviews.text: Used this 500mm lens (+ 2x converter) with my Nikon D5600 taking photos of the Moon. Very pleased how they turned out! Great lens to have on a budget in my opinion! I’m very new at this so I googled a lot of questions figuring out how to choose correct camera settings etc. Don’t have much experience but the photos made me happy, so thank you for the high quality product at a price I could afford!!
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Subpar
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a lower quality than I’d expected and is very flimsy in design. If I could have actually seen it prior to purchasing, I would not have purchased it. Have used it once and hoping to be able to resell it and purchase one of a higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Created2Cater

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Big Mikes delivered the lens on time and it was very easy to get it on my D3300 Nikon. It does take some getting used to but I have taken some nice pictures of the birds eating at the feeders in the backyard. I have a nice picture of a woodpecker that every time I open the door it flies away. But with this lens I was able to take the picture through the storm door and got a very nice picture. Will post the pictures when I get a chance later. I will try and get some moon photos one it gets a little more nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I wanted a telephoto lens for the eclipse but didn't want to spend a huge amount of money. It did exactly what I needed it to! It fit with the mount on my D3300 but definitely needs a tripod as it is basically impossible to hold steady. You have to use manual mode and it takes some practicing to be confident. I need more practice but so far this lens has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Snow

customer_reviews.title: It’s an inexpensive telephoto lens not a zoom lens.
customer_reviews.text: This telephoto lens is just what it say it is. It’s not going to give you the best quality picture and everything is done manually. But for the price it’s fun to use and improve your skills using your camera manually. I’ve included 3 photos, 1 moving subject, 1 still of a moving subject and 1 still of a sign at the max distance of 500 ft to show it’s clarity when focused. I did not use the 2x converter.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great Company!
customer_reviews.text: This Lens is Awesome! It takes the clearest pictures. The lens is Manual and is really no problem. I was needing some training working with manual settings. The Team at Big Mikes are Great and Very Helpful with assisting. I would Highly recommend Big Mikes! I myself will be a return customer. Thanks. Jesse
customer_reviews.author: jesse r leonard

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby for his birthday (Christmas) and he loves it, fits his camera perfectly, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Schellhaas

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens... if I had known it was a vivitar I would not have waited so long to buy it... well worth the price... I'm shooting with it on a D3100 and a D3400 Nikon... performs outstanding...
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: Getting the right parts
customer_reviews.text: This is the wrong part I need to returned and get thee right parts for my camera thank you
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: this is not auto focus
customer_reviews.text: I knew this wasn't an autofocus lens, but I thought it would be a little bit stronger than what it is. All in all, its a nice lens, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Penny B

customer_reviews.title: For the price
customer_reviews.text: It's not great, but it does the job. Wish I could afford something better, but this works for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jess G.

customer_reviews.title: You must use a tripod and I would recommend a remote also but not necessary
customer_reviews.text: There is a learning curve when using this lens. You must use a tripod and I would recommend a remote also but not necessary. But once you get use to the manual focus, this lens is a great deal !! The instructions that came with the lens were a big help. I would recommend this lens to anyone who wants to get closer and has the patience to learn how to use the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Earll

customer_reviews.title: great lens for price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this lens to take nature pictures. Works well it is manual so keep that in mind but was very easy to set up I use it with a nikon D3200
customer_reviews.author: John Arzberger

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is manual. You will need to be patient to get a good picture. But for the price it is not bad. I still can not tell how durable this it. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: O. Raimi

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens for long distance outdoor wildlife shots
customer_reviews.text: Great manual focus lens for the price. Great for long distance wildlife or celestial shots with or without the use of a tripod. Make sure you know how to manual focus and set the F stop before purchasing this item. If you are familiar with DSLR camera settings you should have no problem with this item. A complete novice will find this item hard to use without sufficient practice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nagy

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I would not buy if you don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I would not buy if you don't know your manual settings..It took me a few to adjust,but nice picture's for the price =) Yes I would buy again...I added just a quick one of the moon from 2-24 Minneapolis,Minnesota...Would be better off away from city lights but I love it!Thanks Big Mike!!! Candice
customer_reviews.author: candice

customer_reviews.title: I like this
customer_reviews.text: This was my first manual lense and my first TelePhoto. I like it a lot. Its optics are pretty impressive. Its light and easy to handle. Downside - if you screw the pieces together too tightly, it takes a while to get them back apart. I did it by accident and took me a quite some time to realize how to fix it; by then my photo op was gone. Live and learn. Otherwise its a great MANUAL lense.
customer_reviews.author: BanDiT

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product! I ordered it for Christmas and got it in time! I took great pictures of the full moon on Christmas eve! Would definitely recommend this lens and company to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Quality lens.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted, takes awhile to get used to but quality is great. It is manual but all I could afford, works great! I would most definitely recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: jcantre50

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for the eclipse and couldn't be happier with it. My pics came out great. I had trouble with the 2x lens but haven't taken the time to look closely at it. I was happy to find that it's a Vivitar lens.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Heffernan

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I tried this as soon as it arrived. The picture I took was clear definitely need a tripod to balance unless you’re seated. At least for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon lens
customer_reviews.text: My wife truly love the lens, great picture of the moon. Awesome gift.
customer_reviews.author: kenogal

customer_reviews.title: Good value, helps to know how to operate an old school SLR manually
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lens for the money, as long as you can still manually operate a digital SLR as you would an old school SLR including speed/aperture settings. If you have issues with results, the included tip sheet helps.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great product, amazing quality!
customer_reviews.text: You get much more than what you pay for. Easy to use. My first night was full moon and the pictures came out amazing without much effort. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not horribly excited about it
customer_reviews.text: Came as described in the advertisement, a lot softer on the focus than I thought was appropriate. Not horribly excited about it, but it will get me by until I can afford better.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia B.

customer_reviews.title: I was wrong with my first review.
customer_reviews.text: Ok I have to come clean here and I gave this lens a bad review. Actually it turned out to be operator error. I do have a 500 and 1000 mm lens. While it is a difficult lens to work with as it is 100% manual, The lens is actually very good, for the price. Sorry for the misunderstanding. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent manual lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent manual lens! It was a great learning tool for me, I've learned a lot about my camera using this! Great photos!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Nicol

customer_reviews.title: 3 STAR
customer_reviews.text: OK LENS FOR THE PRICE. PLASTIC TRIPOD MOUNTING RING KEEPS BREAKING RENDERING IT HANDHELD ONLY--NOT GOOD ON A 500 MM LENS Addendum--I am told that Mike received a shipment of bad rings and the new ones are stronger. All in all this is a great lens for the price. Mike's customer service is a 10 star
customer_reviews.author: Russell L. Page, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I used the 500mm lens for the supermonn last night it worked great, wish the converter fit
customer_reviews.text: The 2x converter does not fit the lens? I used the 500mm lens for the supermonn last night it worked great, wish the converter fit. Called BIG MIKE'S and the were great they shipped me a new one overnight. Hey we all make mistakes, but they were great, professional and quickly fixed the issue. Great people to deal with!
customer_reviews.author: S.E.A.L

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good lens for the money. Picture quality is good but is best used on sunny days because it's an f8.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Marv

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Fun Learning Lens for Longer Range Shots
customer_reviews.text: It's an inexpensive lens. Being a hobbiest photographer, it's what I wanted for moon shots and other longer range subjects. It is what it is, I knew I wasn't getting an $8,000 lens. But I'm having fun with it. I appreciated the extra instruction sheet that came with the lens. It has been helpful. Still learning. It's a manual lens and takes a bit of work with focusing properly, but I'm getting there. Well packaged when it came. I'm using it with my Nikon D5500 camera. Works on the manual setting only, as far as I can tell, with this camera. First time out, I took this moon photo. Fun.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna Dane

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. I wish I could afford better and more powerful. Good amateur starter like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Chasity Scott

customer_reviews.title: Photos were too dark.
customer_reviews.text: Photo quality was worse than the cheap telephoto lens for my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Steff

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job!
customer_reviews.text: For the price it does what it needs to do! If you a lense like this to use until you can purchase a higher end one, I'd recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Madman Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love this guy
customer_reviews.text: Love this guy! Cannot afford a top of the line and need something for my son's band concerts and on the field at games. I have not been to an event like that yet, but have used around the house and think it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: This lens is horrible. My sister and I both got it and ...
customer_reviews.text: SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! This lens is horrible. My sister and I both got it and neither of us will ever use it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Still a good product
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to figure it out. Nice solid. Having trouble getting pics to show up lighter
customer_reviews.author: Gail A. Spink

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with my purchase, the lens arrived and is exactly as described, it is a Vivitar Lens and very sturdy, I will probably use a tri-pod with thiis as it is a little much to hold still. I took several pictures just plating around and at 1000 ft had a nice Image. more later.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wood

customer_reviews.title: Has to be steady mono pod worked great
customer_reviews.text: Manual lens, my Nikon D7000 works great in aperture priority mode
customer_reviews.author: Leo K.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens far exceeded my expectations! I am an amateur photographer and I needed a lens for the eclipse. I was so nervous that the lens would be more than my skill level could handle... I am beyond pleased! Maybe not professional quality but a great lens
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great product at very low price.
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting the quality for the price. This lens is more than I thought I would get for only $119. Couldn't be happier and can't wait to get out and take pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Wood Sprite

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: When I first received my lens, I did not know how to operate it. Well after receiving help from the sellers, I'm having a blast with my lens. I highly recommend the lens and the company. They truly stand behind their product. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: It does take great shots.
customer_reviews.text: I'll say 4 stars as I have no clue what I'm doing. It does take great shots...amazing how up close the objects are, even from way down the street. Can't wait to try it out on a tripod...it is a heavy lens.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for the super moon
customer_reviews.text: I'm very new to DSLR. I bought my refurbished Nikon 3200 here at Amazon a couple of months ago. So i bought this telephoto lens for today Nov 14th's super moon. It arrived Saturday Nov 12. I tried it the next day, googled and went to YouTube how to shoot the super moon and I'd say this newbie is very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dignity

customer_reviews.title: Great Telephoto Lens for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Nikon D7100 camera. I have only had a chance to play with this indoors, but am looking forward to taking out for some nature shots soon. The Lens is sturdy and fits beautifully. Will post additional notes along with sample photos once I have taken it out for a full spin.
customer_reviews.author: Artemis

customer_reviews.title: For the price, pretty good.... But a lot of work in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are okay, but still difficult to use. The instructions look like they have been photocopied 100's of times.
customer_reviews.author: SpiderShutter

customer_reviews.title: Field of view is limited, but expected for the price. The 1000 x not practical to use for very much.
customer_reviews.text: Shooting pics of birds in back yard. Best to use with tripod due to front over weight. For those that like shooting in "auto," this scope is not recommended. Quality of scope is pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lohnes

customer_reviews.title: Ug
customer_reviews.text: followed directions attatched to my Nikon D3200 didnt work, put my Nikor lense back on, neither camera nor nikor lens has worked sense
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Nice telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with item. Because this is a totally manual lens, it has a bit of a learning curve, however, documentation is provided to assist with that. I'm looking forward to learning about the types of photos I can create with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Way

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I got some great eclipse pictures with this lens on my Nikon D3400.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vivitar 500mm/1000mm manual lens.
customer_reviews.text: Vivitar manual telephoto lens works well on my D3100 for the price. Focus can be tricky, but it brings things closer.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: Well made,good quality but takes some practice to get everything in focus.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: A nice lens with affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for Telephoto Lens for a long time but the lens price from Nikon seems to be too expensive. Finally I found it from Big Mike's Electronics through Amazon. It is easy and straightforward to assemble and hook to my Nikon D7100 with included adapter. My first photo is to take a picture over a 30 feet high tree leaf from over 300 feet away, and the result is amazing. I never expect that it is so clear! Since then, I have taken many pictures including light house, moon etc. and I am happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Must be in manual mode to use
customer_reviews.text: Have not used yet but appears to be high quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely need a good tripod to hold it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need a good tripod to hold it. Quite a bit of weight to it with the long length. Also takes some practice to get the manual focus figured out. Works better in bright sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low price view
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had much time to use this to date but it is what I expected. Would prefer one with auto focus but that would be way out of my price range. Good quality, package very well. The printed instructions that came with this lens is great, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas E. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: good lens, great service
customer_reviews.text: for the price, this lens delivers. it does exactly what a lens this size is supposed to do, but is manual, so you will need knowledge of how to shoot in manual. sturdy body, metal attachments. purchased from big mike's electronics and their service is extraordinary. will make all my future camera purchases from big mike's electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lens does not work with digital Nikon camera
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with digital camera. Item description is misleading. So cannot use the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its manual , its hard to get the focus desired
customer_reviews.text: Still can't figure out gettibg it right. It's either to dark or to light
customer_reviews.author: S.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: WOW, Everything i hoped for and more. Awsome price, Awsome product, Awsome seller
customer_reviews.author: k.s.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this item. We have invested in good equipment as an investment in her.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was described. Works great. Would suggest buying a stand and a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice telephoto for beginners. However, if you want to use the 2X teleconverter you will need a tripod, otherwise your photos will come out blurry. Also, it's not possible to remove the tripod adapter ring. Also, if anyone is wondering, you CANNOT zoom in or zoom out with this lens. The focal length is fixed on 500mm, if you put the converter on, it becomes fixed on 1000mm. I asked this question here before buying it and nobody answered it clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Pineda

product_meta.title: High-Power 500mm/1000mm f/8 Manual Telephoto Lens for Nikon D7500, D500, D600, D610, D700, D750, D800, D810, D850, D3100, D3200, D3300, D3400, D5100, D5200, D5300, D5500, D5600, D7000, D7100, D7200
feature_bullets: Includes T-mount adapter for digital and 35mm NIKON DSLR cameras
High index, low-dispersion multi-coated optical glass to reduce flare
2X Teleconverter doubles the power of your lens to 1000mm.
